text.section:
Any transporter may apply to the Administration for:
Registration of its business; and
On registration, the issuance of as many special, transporter registration plates as the Administration authorizes.

A transporter may not be registered under this section unless the business of the transporter:
Is equipped to perform the services indicated on the application; and
Has facilities adequate for the type of business that the transporter proposes to conduct.

section.section: The registration of a transporter under this section expires at the time that the Administration designates when it registers the transporter.
After the expiration of its registration, a transporter may not exercise the privileges granted by this section until his registration has been renewed.

text.section: A transporter registered under this section immediately shall notify the Administration in writing of any change of address, business name, business designation, or any other information given on or with his last application for registration or renewal.

Transporter registration plates may be used only:
On a vehicle in the possession of, but not owned by, the transporter, if the vehicle is operated to facilitate delivery, inspection, repair, painting, remodeling, the installation of equipment on it, or relocation among storage facilities and points of pickup and delivery, and not for any personal, private, or public use; and
On a new or used mobile or modular home, if the transporter submits evidence of:
Proper registration of the towing vehicle; and
Commercial insurance as required by the Administration.
